title: (x) Quirky serif for Vienna Secession / Type ID on arty invitation - Larish {Mike Y}
content:
Can someone help me ID this font? would be amazingly appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tiloschultz_4237.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tiloschultz_text_3929.jpg)
author: Saara

comments.content:
I'm guessing it's custom.  
If no one finds it and you want something similar, try [EF Leamington](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=ef+leamington).

[Rudolph](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157/http:/www.hubertjocham.de/item.php/type/display/Rudolph/) is also somewhat similar. a gut feeling tells me Hubert Jocham, its designer, might be able to identify the typeface in your sample.

Somehow it's saying venetian oldstyle to me.

hhp

This might be another time to check Georg's [Bleisetzer site](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157/http:/www.bleisetzer.de/cms/front_content.php?idcat=41).

- Mike Yanega

Well, unless I missed it, I don't think it's at that site. Next is to skim through Jaspert's book on Type Faces.

- Mike Yanega

Sorry. I didn't see it there either.

What is the age of this sample?

- Mike Yanega
That looks like work from the art space Vienna Secession. Their identity was designed by Radim Pesko so I would expect that the type is custom.

I wrote an e-mail to Radim Pesko and he graciously sent back this reply and image.

"The font is called 'Larish' and was indeed drawn specially for  
Secession identity which was developed together with Willi Schmid,  
in 2007-2008. Its appearence is inspired by an old prints from  
Vienna of late 19th century. Even it is not re-drawn typeface,  
its shape it true to the spirit to its example.  
Larish will be completed with italic released in Spring 2009."

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157im_/http:/typophile.com/files/spec040307small_3555.gif)

Nice (in at least two ways).

BTW, will the hairline weight be called Vienna Recession? ;-)

hhp
thanks everybody! i guess i could've just asked my teacher Radim then..
Larish Alte is not available for licensing, but [Larish Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish) is available now.

Thanks for following up on this Akira. I have just made a test sample for the Serif Guide.

- Mike Yanega

_Freshly redrawn and extended Larish Alte will be available for licensing in single weight in May 2011._  
 [http://www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-alte](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-alte "http://www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-alte")

Finally Larish Alte has been released.  
 [http://www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-alte](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002157/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-alte "http://www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-alte")
